text: Chlorine is used in water purification because it

The number of hydrogen ions in 1.0dm\(^3\) of a 0.25 mole tetraoxosulphate(Vl) acid solution is
[Avogadro constant = 6.02 x 10\(^{23}\)]
explanation:
Given :
Number of moles = 0.25 mole, Avogadro number = 6.02 x 10\(^{23}\)  Number of ions = ?
Recall that  Number of moles = \(\frac{Number of ions}{Avogadro number}\)
0.25 = \(\frac{Number of ions}{6.02 x 10\(^{23}\)}\)
Number of ions = 0.25 x  6.02 x 10\(^{23}\)
=1.50 x 10\(^{23}\)

text: B is an isotope of the element \(^{238} _{92}Ur\). The isotope B has
explanation:
The element \(^{238} _{92}Ur\) ⇒ Mass number = 238
Atomic number = 92
Recall that Mass number = Number of protons  +  Number of  neutrons  while atomic number = number of protons
So, Mass number =  Number of protons + Number of neutrons
238     =        92         +    Number of neutrons
Number of neutrons = 238 - 92 = 146 neutrons
Number of protons  = 92
Therefore, there are 92 protons and 146 neutrons - Option C

text: Naturally occurring lithium consists of 90% \( ^7_3Li \text{ and 10% } ^6_3 Li. \) What is the relative atomic mass of lithium?
explanation:
the relative atomic mass of lithium = percentage abundance times the mass number of the first isotope + percentage abundance times the mass number of the second isotope.
the relative atomic mass of lithium = ( \(\frac{90}{100} \times7 + \frac{10}{100} \times 6\)) =(( 0.9 x 7) + (0.1 x 6)) = 6.3 + 0.6 = 6.9.

text: What mass of silver is deposited when a current of 2.6 A is passed through a solution of a silver salt for 40 minutes? [Ag= 108 ; F=96500C]
An atom of element X has an electronic configuration of \( 1s^22S^22p^63s^23p^3. \) In which group of the periodic table is X?
explanation:
You can determine the group of an element by the number of electrons of their outermost shell.
Hence; this element silicon belongs to group 5 OR The Group to which an element belongs to, can be identified by adding the number of electrons of the orbital with the highest principal quantum number, in this case, 3s2 and 3p3. Therefore, 2+3 is equal to 5
note; if the highest principal quantum number is just 3s2 for example then the element belong to group 2.

text: Which metal bromide is widely used in photography?
How many Faradays of electricity are required to liberate 9g of aluminium? [Al = 27]
At s.t.p, a mole of chlorine occupies 22.4dm3. If the temperature is changed to 35°C and the pressure to 750mHg the of the new volume will be [Cl = 35.5]
explanation:
Using the general gas law, \(\frac{P_1 \times V_1}{T_1}\) = \(\frac{P_2 \times V_2}{T_2}\)
At STP, P1 = 760mmHg, V1 = 22.4dm3, T1 = 273K, P2 = 750mmHg, V2 = ? and T2 = 350C = 35 + 273 = 308K
making \(V_2\) subject of formula, then \(V_2\) = \(\frac{P_1\times V_1\times T_2}{P_2\times T_1}\)
\(V_2\) =  \(\frac{760\times 22.4\times 308}{750\times 273}\)

text: What is the concentration (mol dm\(^{-3}\)) of a solution containing 28 g of potassium hydroxide per 100 cm\(^3\) of solution? (K=39; H=1; O=16)
explanation:
You can apply any of the two methods below:
METHOD 1: The use of the solubility formula, which is;
Solubility = \(\frac{mass}{Molar mass}\) X \(\frac{1000}{Volume of Solvent}\)
But Molar mass of KOH = 39 + 16 + 1 = 56g/mol
Also given; mass of KOH = 28g
Volume of Solvent used = 100cm\(^3\)
Solubility = \(\frac{28}{56}\) X \(\frac{1000}{100}\)
= 5 moldm\(^{-3}\)
METHOD 2: Using the simple proportion method
If        28g of KOH was dissolved in 100cm\(^3\) of water
then,  Xg of KOH will be dissolved in 1000cm\(^3\) of water
X = \(\frac{{28}\times{1000}}{100}\)
X = 280 gdm\(^{-3}\)
Recall that Molar Concentration (mol dm\(^{-3}\)) = \(\frac{Mass Concentration}{Molar mass}\)
= \(\frac{280}{56}\)
= 5 moldm\(^{-3}\)
Kindly choose any of the methods you find easier and comprehending.

text:
What is the change in the oxidation number of phosphorus in the following reaction?

4P(s) + 5O2(ag) → 2P2O5(s)
In the reaction 2H2S(g) + SO2(g) → 2H2SO(I)+3S(s)SO2is acting as _agent
What is the number of moles of NaHCO3in 250cm3 of its solution if the solution contains 8.4 g of NaHCO3 in 1 dm3 of the solution. [Na = 23, 0 = 16, C = 12, H = 1)
explanation:
no of mole in 250\(cm^3\) of its solution is about molar concentration.
using n = cv
c = \(\frac{n}{v}\)
where c = molar concentration, n = number of moles and v = volume in \(dm^3\)
number of mole of NaHCO3 = mass of NaHCO3 / molar mass of NaHCO3 = \(\frac{8.4}{84}\) = 0.1moles
but v = 250\(cm^3\) = 250/1000 = 0.25\(dm^3\)
therefore c = 0.25 x 0.1 = 0.025mol\(dm^3\)
